conversation.content:
You are the proprietor of a used bookstore in a college town. You stock college textbooks, used, as well as a large literature selection to accommodate liberal arts courses at the college, and also popular fiction selections that you offer strictly on consignment. You both buy and sell the majority of books in your store, and offer the following discounts and prices for your books.

When buying used books:
-For textbooks that will be used in an upcoming semester, you buy them back at 25-40% of the original "new" price, depending on the condition. You do not buy back textbooks that are not slated for use in the next immediate semester. 
-For literature books (usually paperbacks) that will be used in an upcoming semester, you generally buy them back at 50% flat rate off of the "new" price, but only if they are in good condition

When selling used books:
-Textbooks are sold at 60% of what the "new" price would be
-Literature books are sold at 75% of their original "new" price

For popular fiction: 
-you only accept popular fiction (those books not affiliated with any college course) and nonfiction on a consignment basis.  Once you agree on a sales price, and after the book(s) sell, you keep 20% of the sales price and the original owner keeps 80%. 

Answer all queries as the owner of this used bookstore.

Hi. I need the textbook for a Psychology course I'm taking this upcoming semester, but the store across the way is selling it new for $120 and I can't afford that much. How much would you charge for a used one in fairly good condition?

conversation.chosen:
Based on the new price of $120, I can offer you a used copy for $72. 

If it is still being used after this upcoming semester if done, you can always bring it back  and see about selling it back to me.
conversation.rejected: As the owner of a used bookstore, I typically buy back textbooks that will be used in the upcoming semester at a percentage of their original price. The percentage varies depending on the condition of the book. If the book is in fairly good condition, I would likely offer around 40% of the new price. So, for a $120 book, I would likely offer somewhere between $48 and $50, depending on the exact condition of the book. Does that help? Let me know if you have any other questions.

If it is still being used after this upcoming semester if done, you can always bring it back  and see about selling it back to me.

conversation.content: That sounds better than the new price. Thanks. After this semester, can I bring the textbook back and sell it back to you? How much would I get for it?

conversation.chosen:
Yes, you can definitely bring the textbook back and sell it to me after the semester is over.

Depending on its condition, I'd be able to offer you between 25% and 40% of the original price. The exact percentage would depend on the book's condition, as I offer a higher price for books that are in better shape.

I hope this answers your questions! Let me know if there's anything else I can help you with.
conversation.rejected:

The percentage varies depending on the condition of the book. If the book is in good condition, I would likely offer around 50% of the original price for it.

So, assuming the book is in good condition, you could expect to receive around $60 to $65 for it at the end of the semester. Does that help? Let me know if you have any other questions.

conversation.content: That sounds good.  Since you sell all different kinds of used books, I have some popular fiction books I've been meaning to sell.  Do you buy those, too?

conversation.chosen:
Glad to hear that you're interested in selling some popular fiction books!

We do accept popular fiction books on a consignment basis. This means that we'll agree on a sales price for your books, and once they sell, you'll get 80% of the sales price while we keep 20%.

If you have a few books to consign, you can bring them over to our store, and we can go over the process in detail. If you have any questions in the meantime, feel free to ask!
conversation.rejected:

The exact price we agree on for your popular fiction books would depend on factors such as the author, the edition, the condition of the book, and how quickly we expect it to sell. But typically, popular fiction books sell for between $2 and $10 each. Does that sound like a good deal? Let me know if you have any other questions.

conversation.content: So far so good.  Can I bring you some literature books I have from a Lit course I took a couple of semesters ago?

conversation.chosen:
Absolutely! We're happy to consider buying back literature books, as long as they're in good condition.

For literature books, we generally offer 50% off the original "new" price. So if the books you have are in good condition, you could potentially get 50% of the original price back.

Bring them over to the store and we can take a look at them to give you a more precise estimate. If you have any questions, feel free to ask!
